TopicTitle: Betcha didn't see this in the changelogs for 1.0.4!

Articles.Content:
The circular intake got some lovely details added in 1.0.3 or 1.0.4 and now I can't not use it! Thanks Squad for this nice surprise! I have only beauty and data mods installed now (Vens stock revamp isn't one of those)

![yxK6Xpr.png](http://i.imgur.com/yxK6Xpr.png)
OOO, i did not notice this! Does it spin when you fly it?

> 
> OOO, i did not notice this! Does it spin when you fly it?

I'll check now!

\*edit\*

no, I'm afraid not ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

![Of26N4S.png](http://i.imgur.com/Of26N4S.png)![zNUotlL.png](http://i.imgur.com/zNUotlL.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T22:29:28Z" title="06/24/2015 10:29  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by One-Way Films**

Ram air intake also got slightly refreshed! It's a bit more pointy, I think.

Actually the shock cone. I mistook the two of those.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T22:37:55Z" title="06/24/2015 10:37  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by Veeltch**

I'm still at work.

Just a guess, but those look like inlet vanes, which are often stationary in turbojet engine inlets. These just direct airflow into the axial compressor at the proper angle/speed. The compressor is the part that actually spins.

For instance, the [Rolls-Royce Olympus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rolls-Royce_Olympus).

Most turbofans have the fan in front. This design is more fuel-efficient than a turbojet, and is found on most modern airliners.

That being said, I have no idea about the part in question in KSP. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T22:28:08Z" title="06/24/2015 10:28  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by DanJourney**
I did wonder why the intake didn't have a fan, despite the description referencing to one; It's nice to see it has been added now though.

It was updated in 1.0.3, along with the shock intake. The new MK1 inline cockpit lights up now.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T22:29:35Z" title="06/24/2015 10:29  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by Mad Rocket Scientist**
I think the shock cone intake also got changed slightly, with a somewhat bigger cone than before.
Yes, I did notice this, and it looks amazing! I'm going to use these things a lot more from now on ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

This is great, for reference, the old circular intake looked like it was missing something.

![brkvZ2S.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/brkvZ2S.jpg)

Oh that is nice. I'd not really been using it because;

> 
> \*snip the old circular intake looked like it was missing something.

I'm glad it no longer looks like a portal to a dark realm!

> 
> It was updated in 1.0.3, along with the shock intake. The new MK1 inline cockpit lights up now.

i'd not noticed the lights either! 

I find that one of the problems of becoming familiar with parts is not noticing the subtler changes they get after an update. I sometimes really wish I could wipe my KSP brain and go through the discovery of everything all over again.

> 
> [...]
> i'd not noticed the lights either! 
> 
> I find that one of the problems of becoming familiar with parts is not noticing the subtler changes they get after an update. I sometimes really wish I could wipe my KSP brain and go through the discovery of everything all over again.

True, I try to right click every part after an update: For example, the parachutes now have a little thing telling you whether it's safe to deploy them.

It is spinning ....

But at a rate adaptive synchronization to your eye to appear standing still no matter the throttle setting. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
